records.location_details: Mytilini, Lesvos, Greece, on the street
records.context_note: A Frontex staff member twisted an ankle in a small hole on the street in Mytilini, Lesvos. The injury was minor, and the officer was prescribed crutches for 4 days, not affecting operational availability.
records.evidence_quote: Walking on the street in Mytilini, on 18.06.2020 afternoon, Text Removed - Justification 2 twisted the ankle in a small hole.

records.location_details: Near Chios, Greece, in the borderline of GTW and TTW
records.context_note: A Turkish Coast Guard (TCG) patrol boat harassed a Greek fishing vessel and a Frontex asset (Text Removed - Justification 6) near Chios, Greece, within the borderline of GTW and TTW. The TCG boat engaged in aggressive driving for approximately two hours before returning to the Turkish coast.
records.evidence_quote: they saw a TCG patrol boat driving around of a Greek fishing vessel (AGIA PARASKEVI). The fishing vessel was just in the borderline of GTW and TTW.

records.location_details: On board a vessel deployed to Lesvos, Greece
records.context_note: A Frontex officer fell down and injured their leg (Tibia fissure) during maintenance activity on a vessel deployed to Lesvos, Greece. The officer was requested to rest until the end of deployment.
records.evidence_quote: During maintenance activity of the vessel the officer fell down and injured his leg. At the beginning it didn't appear as a serious accident.

records.location_details: Vial RIC, Chios, Greece
records.context_note: Riots and fires broke out at the Vial RIC in Chios, Greece, following the death of a 49-year-old woman. Offices, canteen, cars, tents, and containers (including Frontex containers) were damaged. Refugees engaged in stone fights with Hellenic Police.
records.evidence_quote: During the night fires broke out in the offices of the Asylum Service, as well as in the canteen of RIC VIAL. Two cars were also set on fire, while the refugees were engaged in a stone fight with HP.

records.location_details: Aegean Sea, during Rapid Border Intervention Aegean 2020
records.context_note: A Frontex asset (Text Removed - Justification 6) was intercepted by two Turkish Air Force F-16s during a Rapid Border Intervention in the Aegean Sea. The asset was challenged 7 times by Turkish radars during the patrol.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 6 was intercepted at 12:36Z by -02- Turkish Airforce F-16.

records.location_details: Surroundings of Vial camp, Chios, Greece
records.context_note: Two Frontex personnel were involved in an incident near Vial camp in Chios, Greece, where demonstrators intercepted and damaged their rental car (broken mirrors). The officers were not physically harmed.
records.evidence_quote: crowd intercepted their vehicle and started damaging the rental car (at least both mirrors are broken).

records.location_details: Port area of Mytilini, Lesvos, and Mantamados area, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location details removed, but Mytilini and Mantamados area mentioned in context.
records.context_note: Violent protests and demonstrations occurred in Mytilini, Lesvos, Greece, against the disembarkation of anti-riot police and the building of a 'Multifunctional Control Centre'. A Frontex patrol was blocked by demonstrators, and their vehicle was damaged. No injuries to Frontex personnel were reported. Clashes between police and locals also occurred in Mantamados area.
records.evidence_quote: Demonstrators were shouting and one of the demonstrators was kicking the right and the front of the Text Removed - Justification 6 broke a mirror of the Text Removed - Justification 6.

records.location_details: Near Alexandroupolis, Nomós Évrou, Greece, during patrol activity
records.context_note: A crew member injured their right knee after sliding off stairs while attempting to take a towing rubber boat during patrol activity near Alexandroupolis, Greece. X-rays showed no broken bones, but stretched ligaments were suspected.
records.evidence_quote: one of the crew members, while attempting to take a towing rubber boat, slid off the stairs and injured his right leg knee.

records.location_details: Evros region, Greece
records.context_note: Frontex TMs and Hellenic Police officers reported hearing gunshots in the Evros region, Greece. The shots were far away, and no visual contact with shooters was made. No injuries were reported.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 2, 3 reported around 7:00 FX TM's Text Removed - Justification 2,3 informed about hearable gunshots Text Removed - Justification 5.

records.location_details: Alexandroupoli Airport, Evros, Greece (weapon found at Sofia Airport, Bulgaria)
records.context_note: A Frontex weapon was lost during handover from airport staff to TMs after a flight from Sofia to Alexandroupolis. It was later found at Sofia Airport, having fallen off the luggage belt. The weapon was returned, and the case is closed.
records.evidence_quote: during handing over the weapons from airport staff to FX TMs, one gun Text Removed - Justification 2 was missed.

records.location_details: Railways between Alexandroupolis and Ormenio, Evros, Greece
records.context_note: A 25-year-old male migrant was hit and killed by a train running from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio in the Evros region, Greece. It is suspected he was sleeping on the railways. An autopsy was requested, and no criminal activity was recognized.
records.evidence_quote: one (01) migrant (male) was hit and killed by train running from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio.

records.location_details: Marasia (border village to the north of Kastanies), Evros, Greece
records.context_note: Frontex teams and GRC patrols reported hearing multiple gunshots coming from Marasia (border village north of Kastanies) in the Evros region, Greece. Some shots were reported to come from a Turkish patrol. No TMs saw the shooters, and the origin was hard to localize due to wind. No casualties reported.
records.evidence_quote: reported that they heard a few possible gunfire shots, coming from Marasia (border village to the north of Kastanies).

records.location_details: Evros region, Greece, near Evros river
records.context_note: Hellenic Police officers found a dead male migrant and two other migrants (his children) in the Evros region, Greece. The deceased was a Syrian national who had entered Greece illegally from the Evros river. An autopsy confirmed heart attack as the cause of death.
records.evidence_quote: HP Officers Text Removed - Justification 3 found 2 migrants (male and female) and a dead body (male).

records.location_details: Evros river, close to the Greek bank, Evros, Greece
records.context_note: A dead male body, approximately thirty years old, was found in the Evros river near the Greek bank. It is likely a migrant who attempted to cross the border. An autopsy showed no criminal activity caused the death.
records.evidence_quote: one (1) male dead body (about thirty years old) has been found in the river of Evros, close to the Greek bank

records.location_details: Evros region, Greece
records.context_note: A dead male body was found in the Evros region, Greece, and reported to Alexandroupolis Police. No travel documents were found. An autopsy was requested to determine the cause of death, which later showed no criminal activity.
records.evidence_quote: a dead body (male) has been found in the area. No travel documents have been found.

records.location_details: Evros region, Greece, from the Turkish side
records.context_note: Four gunshots were heard from the Turkish side in the Evros region, Greece. No Turkish Land Forces or other persons were observed. Frontex personnel were not directly affected, only heard the shots. Greek authorities found it hard to assess the origin.
records.evidence_quote: 4 (four) shots heard on 12.05.2020 at 23:30 from the Turkish side.

records.location_details: Alexandroupolis hospital, Evros, Greece
records.context_note: A Frontex TM deployed in Evros was hospitalized in Alexandroupolis with severe bellyache, initially suspected to be appendicitis and later treated as a possible COVID-19 case due to fever. The TM was recovering and expected to resume duties by end of May/beginning of June.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 2 deployed under RBI 2020 Evros who was transported by Text Removed - Justification 2 to Alexandroupolis hospital, having sevre bellyache.

records.location_details: Evros region, Greece
records.context_note: Two shooting incidents involving Turkish patrol boats were reported in the Evros region, Greece. Two gunshots were heard from one boat, and four from another. No Frontex TMs were involved or injured.
records.evidence_quote: two new shooting incidents in Text Removed - Justification 4, in the same location where shooting incident took place a few days ago: 1- 14:40 hours, 2 gunshots, from a Turkish patrol boat with three persons on board. 2- 14:45 hours, 4 gunshots, from another Turkish patrol boat with six persons on board.

records.location_details: Evros region, Greece
records.context_note: A dead male body, aged 30-35, believed to be a migrant of unknown nationality, was found in the Evros region, Greece. No travel documents were found. An autopsy excluded criminal activity as the cause of death.
records.evidence_quote: a dead body (male), aged between 30-35 has been found in Text Removed - Justification 4.

records.location_details: Evros river, Turkish bank, Evros, Greece
records.context_note: A shooting incident occurred at the Evros river border. A Turkish Gendarmerie patrol fired a gunshot, and a Turkish soldier aimed an assault rifle at Greek/Frontex patrols, then showed a middle finger. Turkish patrol boats were also present. This was assessed as a provocative action. No injuries reported.
records.evidence_quote: HP Officer Text Removed - Justification 4 while patrolling with Text Removed - Justification 2 close to Evros river reported a shooting incident by Turkish Gendarmerie patrol that was patrolling in a close distance at the Turkish bank of the river.

records.location_details: Alexandroupolis, Greece (after returning from Thessaloniki)
records.context_note: A Frontex staff member (Text Removed - Justification 2) in Alexandroupolis tested positive for COVID-19 after returning from leave in Thessaloniki, where confirmed cases were declared. The individual was hospitalized in Alexandroupolis.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 2 in Alexandroupolis reported about a new confirmed case of Covid-19 Text Removed - Justification 4. The infected person is Text Removed - Justification 2.

records.location_details: Military Hospital in Sofia, Bulgaria
records.context_note: A Frontex staff member (Text Removed - Justification 2) was hospitalized in Sofia Military Hospital, Bulgaria, with COVID-19 compatible symptoms (breathing difficulties, chest/lung pain). A COVID-19 test later returned negative. The individual was released and advised to rest for a week as a preventive measure.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 2 has been hospitalized at the Military Hospital in Sofia. According to the doctor, he presented compatible symptoms with Covid-19 such as difficulties while breathing.
